Analysing R Scripts

Hauke Sonnenberg

2018-07-09

Source: vignettes/analyse_scripts.Rmd
analyse_scripts.Rmd

It is quite impressive how, since more or less ten years, more and more people at our research institute Kompetenzzentrum Wasser Berlin began to use the programming language R to support their daily data-related work. As a result, we are currently hosting more than one thousand R scripts in our internal version control system.

It is difficult to keep control over so many files. Therefore, this package contains a function that aims at giving an overview of R script files and the functions defined within these files. Use the function report_about_r_scripts() to create an R Markdown document about all the R script files below a certain root directory:

kwb.fakin::report_about_r_scripts(root = "path/to/your/script/folder")

With the (private) helper functions github_package_path() and github_package_files() that are also contained in the package, we can also report on the R files that are contained in an R package hosted on GitHub. For example, we can have a look at the files that are contained in this package. They are available in the repository kwb.fakin on our GitHub account:

repo <- "kwb-r/kwb.fakin"

kwb.fakin::report_about_r_scripts(
  root = kwb.fakin:::github_package_path(repo, "R"),
  scripts = kwb.fakin:::github_package_files(repo, "R"),
  show = FALSE
)
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/clean_file-name.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/compress_paths.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/convert.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/dictionary.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/encoding.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/github.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/input_output.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/list_files.R ... ok.

#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/manipulate.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/merge_permissions.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/plot.R ... ok.
#> Reading https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kwb-r/kwb.fakin/master/R/plot_path-tree.R ... ok.

#> Rendering '/tmp/Rtmp9ZudHg/file2d016182d8ee5.Rmd' ...
#> processing file: file2d016182d8ee5.Rmd
#> output file: file2d016182d8ee5.knit.md
#> /usr/lib/rstudio-server/bin/pandoc/pandoc +RTS -K512m -RTS file2d016182d8ee5.utf8.md --to html4 --from markdown+autolink_bare_uris+ascii_identifiers+tex_math_single_backslash --output file2d016182d8ee5.html --smart --email-obfuscation none --self-contained --standalone --section-divs --template /home/hsonne/R/packages/rmarkdown/rmd/h/default.html --no-highlight --variable highlightjs=1 --variable 'theme:bootstrap' --include-in-header /tmp/Rtmp9ZudHg/rmarkdown-str2d016297f6a79.html --mathjax --variable 'mathjax-url:https://mathjax.rstudio.com/latest/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML'
#> 
#> Output created: file2d016182d8ee5.html
#> ok.

We set show to FALSE in order to prevent that the created HTML file is opened in a browser.

A shortcut to the above call is:

kwb.fakin:::report_about_github_package("kwb-r/kwb.fakin", show = FALSE)

It is up to you to compare with what the great guys do. Try e.g.

kwb.fakin:::report_about_github_package("tidyverse/dplyr")

Developed by Hauke Sonnenberg.
